flawed_nl_solution:
Ian is able to earn $18 per hour doing surveys. If he worked 8 hours doing surveys, then he earned $18*8 = $<<18*8=414>>414
If he spent half of what he earned, then he spent $414 * 50% = $<<414*50*0.01=207>>207
If Ian spent $207 of his earnings, then he has $414 - $207 = $<<207=207>>207 left

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 144, not 414. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
